meanings.definition: A fit of anger or temper tantrum.
meanings.sent1: During the game, he threw a hissy when he lost.
meanings.sent2: She had a hissy in the store when her mom said no to candy.
meanings.sent3: The cat had a hissy over the new dog in the house.
meanings.sent4: The storm outside matched the hissy happening inside the house.
meanings.sent5: The hissy at the party was so loud, everyone heard it.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or prone to fits of anger or temper tantrums.
meanings.sent1: Her hissy behavior made it hard to calm her down.
meanings.sent2: The toddler's hissy outburst surprised everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The hissy puppy chewed up all the shoes in the house.
meanings.sent4: The hissy clouds in the sky warned of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: His hissy attitude made it difficult to work with him.
